description: From Middle English bousen, from Middle Dutch būsen, buisen, buysen (“to drink heavily”) (Dutch buizen). Related to Middle High German būsen (“to swell, inblow”). More at beer.

entries.meaning: A carouse; a drinking bout; a booze.

verbs.description: bowse (third-person singular simple present bowses, present participle bowsing, simple past and past participle bowsed)

entries.meaning: (archaic) To drink excessively and socially; to carouse.

verbs.description: bowse (third-person singular simple present bowses, present participle bowsing, simple past and past participle bowsed)

entries.meaning: (nautical) To haul or hoist (something) with a tackle.
